name: Kepler-314
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-314 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-314 is a star with 0.8719999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.95 times its radius. It is located 883.78 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-314 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-314 b

Kepler-314 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.46 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-314.

The mass of Kepler-314 b is 0.61 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-314 b is 0.83 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-314 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-314 c

Kepler-314 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.96 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-314.

The mass of Kepler-314 c is 12.42 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-314 c is 2.9 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-314 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-314, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
